Data Cube (martini.DataCube)¶

class martini._datacube.DataCube(n_px_x=256, n_px_y=256, n_channels=64, px_size=<Quantity 15. arcsec>, channel_width=<Quantity 4. km / s>, velocity_centre=<Quantity 0. km / s>, ra=<Quantity 0. deg>, dec=<Quantity 0. deg>)[source]¶

Handles creation and management of the data cube itself.

Basic usage simply involves initializing with the parameters listed below. More advanced usage might arise if designing custom classes for other sub- modules, especially beams. To initialize a DataCube from a saved state, see DataCube.load_state.

Parameters:

n_px_x : int, optional

Pixel count along the x (RA) axis. Even integers strongly preferred. (Default: 256.)

n_px_y : int, optional

Pixel count along the y (Dec) axis. Even integers strongly preferred. (Default: 256.)

n_channels : int, optional

Number of channels along the spectral axis. (Default: 64.)

px_size : Quantity, with dimensions of angle, optional

Angular scale of one pixel. (Default: 15 arcsec.)

channel_width : Quantity, with dimensions of velocity, optional

Step size along the spectral axis. Must be provided as a velocity. (Default: 4 km/s.)

velocity_centre : Quantity, with dimensions of velocity, optional

Velocity of the central channel along the spectral axis. (Default: 0 km/s.)

ra : Quantity, with dimensions of angle, optional

Right ascension of the cube centroid. (Default: 0 deg.)

dec : Quantity, with dimensions of angle, optional

Declination of the cube centroid. (Default: 0 deg.)
add_pad(pad)[source]¶

Resize the cube to add a padding region in the spatial direction.

Accurate convolution with a beam requires a cube padded according to the size of the beam kernel (its representation sampled on a grid with the same spacing). The beam class is required to handle defining the size of pad required.

Parameters:

pad : 2-tuple (or other sequence)

Number of pixels to add in the x (RA) and y (Dec) directions.

See also

drop_pad

copy()[source]¶

Produce a copy of the DataCube.

May be especially useful to create multiple datacubes with differing intermediate steps.

Returns:

out : DataCube

Copy of the DataCube object.
drop_pad()[source]¶

Remove the padding added using add_pad.

After convolution, the pad region contains meaningless information and can be discarded.

See also

add_pad

freq_channels()[source]¶

Convert spectral axis to frequency units.

classmethod load_state(filename)[source]¶

Initialize a DataCube from a state saved using DataCube.save_state. Note that h5py must be installed for use. Note that ONLY the DataCube state is restored, other modules and their configurations are not affected.

Parameters:

filename : str

File to open.
Returns:

out : martini.DataCube

A suitably initialized DataCube object.
save_state(filename, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Write a file from which the current DataCube state can be re-initialized (see DataCube.load_state). Note that h5py must be installed for use. NOT for outputting mock observations, for this see Martini.write_fits and Martini.write_hdf5.

Parameters:

filename : str

File to write.

overwrite : bool

Whether to allow overwriting existing files (default: False).
spatial_slices()[source]¶

Return an iterator over the spatial ‘slices’ of the cube.

Returns:

out : iterator

Iterator over the spatial ‘slices’ of the cube.
spectra()[source]¶

Return an iterator over the spectra (one in each spatial pixel).

Returns:

out : iterator

Iterator over the spectra (one in each spatial pixel).
velocity_channels()[source]¶

Convert spectral axis (back) to velocity units.
